content:
PROCEDURE CODE
1161
If a sealed envelope or sealed packet is found which appears to concern the succession or undivided co-ownership, the justice of the peace opens it after ascertaining the external form, the seal and the description; he initials the envelope and the document with the parties.
If the document appears to belong to a third party, the justice of the peace shall note the external form, the seal and the inscription, initial the envelope with the parties and order the document to be handed over to whom it may concern.
